title: Li Qian (boxer)
text:
Li Qian (; born 6 June 1990) is a Chinese <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. She won the bronze medal in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20middleweight">women's middleweight class</a> at the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a>, and a silver medal in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20middleweight">same event</a> at the delayed <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a>.
Career.
Li was born in <a href="Henan">Henan</a>. She and her parents moved to <a href="Ordos%20%28city%29">Ordos</a>, <a href="Inner%20Mongolia">Inner Mongolia</a> in 2001. While studying at the Inner Mongolia Vocational College of Physical Education, she played <a href="basketball">basketball</a>. Her height and arm length drew the attention of Chinese boxing team coach Ha Dabater, who recommended her for the Inner Mongolian boxing team in 2007. She won the bronze medal in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20middleweight">women's middleweight class at the 2016 Summer Olympics</a> in Rio de Janeiro. She won a silver medal in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20middleweight">middleweight</a> event at the delayed <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a>, losing to <a href="Lauren%20Price">Lauren Price</a> in the final.
